page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF SANDWICK
page.content:
Sandwick is a fairly compact rural area 15 miles south of Lerwick and 12 miles north of Sumburgh. It is not as dependent on farming and crofting as other rural areas, although it does have some, but tends to be more of a village from where many people commute to work in surrounding areas, mainly Lerwick, Sumburgh airport and the oil base at Sullom Voe. The houses are quite near together and are found in groups. Most are built single storey because of the wind in Shetland. The school accomodates local primary schoolchildren plus the children aged 12 to 16 years from Cunningsburgh to the north and all of the area to the south.
]
